conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C.
Predict which container (D or E) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
There are three streams labeled A, B, and C at the top of the image.
There are tilted baffles positioned to deflect incoming streams.
There are two containers labeled D and E at the bottom of the image.
Each tilted baffle is positioned so that an incoming stream strikes the baffle, slides along its slope, and is deflected either leftward or rightward.
Following the successive deflections, the yellow stream that begins at A ends up at the left outlet.
The two streams that begin at B and C are both steered toward the central/right outlet that feeds container E.
Stream A will be directed to container D.
Stream B will be directed to container E.
Stream C will be directed to container E.
